\pard\cf1\f0\fs24\lang1033 ###Turkey. \f1\lang1049 Questions\par
\par
\f0\lang1033 #words\par
\f2\lang1055 meslek\f0\lang1033 . profeccion.\f1\lang1049\par
\f2\lang1055 bu\f0\lang1033 . it, this.\f1\lang1049\par
\par
\f2\lang1055 Kim tavuk yer? \f0\lang1033 Who eats chicken?\par
\f2\lang1055 Neredesin?\f0\lang1033  Where are you?\par
Senin ad\f3\u305?n ne?\f0  What is your name?\par
\par
Neden ben? Why me?\par
\f1\lang1049 Nas\f3\u305?l?\f0\lang1033  How?\par
Bu elma kimin? Whose apple is this?\par
Ne, neden, ve nas\f3\u305?l?\f0  What, why, and how?\par
\f2\lang1055 Onlar neredeler? \f0\lang1033 Where are they?\par
Hangi k\'f6pek senin? Which dog is yours?\par
Hangisi o? Which is it?\par
\par
Senin sorunun bir cevab\f3\u305? yok.\f0  Your question does not have an answer.\par
soru + n(2nd sing. possessive) + un(genitive ending meaning "of")\par
\f2\lang1055 cevab\f3\u305?\f2  (b\f3\u305?\f2  \f0\lang1033 posesses to \f2\lang1055 sorunun)\f0\lang1033\par
Onun sorusunun bir cevab\f3\u305? yok.\par
Senin sorular\u305?n\u305?n bir cevab\u305? yok.\par
Sorunuzun cevab\u305? yok\par
bir sorum var\f0\par
\par
Ne kadar \f3\'baekeriniz var?\f0  How much sugar do you have?\par
\f2\lang1055 N\f0\lang1033 e kadar s\'fct\'fcm\'fcz var\f2\lang1055 ? How much milk do we have?\f0\lang1033\par
\f2\lang1055 Hangisi benim? \f0\lang1033 Which is mine?\par
\f2\lang1055 Sizin sorunuzun bir cevab\f3\u305?\f2  yok.\par
O ne? \f0\lang1033 What is it?\par
O kim? Who is that?\f2\lang1055  Who is it?\f0\lang1033\par
Kimin \'e7ay\f3\u305? o?\f0  Whose tea is it?\par
Kaplumba\f3\u287?a kimin?\f2\lang1055  Whose is the turtle?\par
K\f0\lang1033\'fc\'e7\'fck kedim nerede?\f2\lang1055  Where is my little cat?\f0\lang1033\par
\f2\lang1055 Hangisi benim\f0\lang1033 ? Which is mine?\par
Hangisi onun k\'f6pe\f3\u287?i?\f0  Which is his dog?\par
\par
\f2\lang1055 Sizin i\f3\'ba\f2 iniz ne\f0\lang1033 ? What is your job?\par
\f2\lang1055 Ka\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055  tane\f0\lang1033 ? How many?\par
\f2\lang1055 Ka\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055  tane kedi var\f0\lang1033 ? How many cats are there?\par
\f1\lang1049 Ne kadar?\f0\lang1033  How much?\par
\par
Bu elma kimin? Whose apple is this?\par
Onun sorular\f3\lang1055\u305?\f2 , l\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 tfen. Her questions please.\f1\lang1049\par
\par
Soru nedir?\f2\lang1055  What is the question?\par
B\f0\lang1033 a\f3\'bakan kim\f2\lang1055 ? Who is the president?\f1\lang1049\par
\par
Senin annen kim?\f2\lang1055  Who is your mother?\f1\lang1049\par
Senin mesle\f3\u287?in ne?\f2\lang1055  What is your profession?\f3\lang1049\par
\f2\lang1055 S\f0\lang1033 enin i\f3\'bain ne?\f2\lang1055  What is your job?\f1\lang1049\par
senin ka\f0\lang1033\'e7 tana kedin var?\par
\f1\lang1049\par
Avrupa\rquote dan m\f3\u305? geliyorsunuz?\f2\lang1055  Do you come from Europe?\par
Buray\f3\u305? be\u287?eniyor musunuz?\f2  Do you like it here?\par
Burada tatil m\f3\u305? yap\u305?yorsunuz?\f2  Are you here on vacation?\par
\par
Yar\f3\u305?n g\f0\lang1033\'f6r\'fc\f3\'baecek miyiz?\f2\lang1055  Shall we see each other tomorrow?\par
\par
>>> 08-05-2021 21:07\par
Hangisi o?\f0\lang1033  \f2\lang1055 Which is it?\par
\f0\lang1033 Q: what does the -si in hangisi mean? is it the 3rd singular possessive?\par
A: It is used a few words to mean "one." For example, you can also say "birisi" for "one person." I would just memorize it in this case :)\par
\par
Q: \f2\lang1055 When do you use "Ka\f0\lang1033\'e7 tane" and when do you use "ne kadar"?\par
A: Ka\'e7 tane is how many. Like How many cats for example. Ne kadar is how much, for example How much money, or how much water, it is used for uncountable nouns. But I'm not sure about this at all.\par
A1: You are right, "ka\'e7 tane" is used only for countable things. But "ne kadar" is useable for both.\par
Ne kadar su? = How much water? Ne kadar para? = How many money? Ne kadar adam? = How many man?\f2\lang1055\par
\par
\f1\lang1049 Senin mesle\f3\u287?in ne?\f0\lang1033  What is your profession?\f1\lang1049\par
Which is his dog?\f0\lang1033  hangisi onun k\'f6pe\f3\u287?i\f0 ?\par
How many cats do you have? Senin ka\'e7 tane kedin var?\par
\f2\lang1055 N\f0\lang1033 e kadar s\'fct\'fcm\'fcz var\f2\lang1055 ?\par
Ka\f0\lang1033\'e7 tane kedi var\f2\lang1055 ? How many cats are there?\f0\lang1033\par
*comment: we use singular nouns after numbers (\'fc\'e7 tane kedi, not \'fc\'e7 tane kediler), we also use singular nouns after "ka\'e7 tane".\par
\par
These questions are very hard. bu sorular \'e7ok zor.\par
\par
Soru nedir? What is the question?\par
Q: Can I say "Soru ne?" ?\par
A: yes, nedir is used to be formal.\par
Q: Can you say "What question?"\par
A: no, that would be "hangi soru?" or maybe "ne sorusu?" depending on the context.\par
Q: (and) what case would be that final "su" (in the world "sorusu")? ^_^\par
A: possessive, I guess you can think of it as "the question of what?".\par
\par
\par
\f1\lang1049\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1251\deff0\nouicompat\deflang1049{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset204 Roboto Condensed;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset0 Roboto Condensed;}{\f2\fnil\fcharset162 Roboto Condensed;}}

\pard\cf1\f0\fs24\par
\par
bu sorular \f1\lang1033\'e7ok zor\par
for example. I am in a class. The teacher asks me a lot of questions.\par
I answer then. \f2\lang1055 Bu sorular \f1\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 ok zor.\par
\par
Senin ka\f1\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055  tane araba var?\f0\lang1049\par
}
TxtContent:
###Turkey. Questions

#words
meslek. profeccion.
bu. it, this.

Kim tavuk yer? Who eats chicken?
Neredesin? Where are you?
Senin adın ne? What is your name?

Neden ben? Why me?
Nasıl? How?
Bu elma kimin? Whose apple is this?
Ne, neden, ve nasıl? What, why, and how?
Onlar neredeler? Where are they?
Hangi köpek senin? Which dog is yours?
Hangisi o? Which is it?

Senin sorunun bir cevabı yok. Your question does not have an answer.
soru + n(2nd sing. possessive) + un(genitive ending meaning "of")
cevabı (bı posesses to sorunun)
Onun sorusunun bir cevabı yok.
Senin sorularının bir cevabı yok.
Sorunuzun cevabı yok
bir sorum var

Ne kadar şekeriniz var? How much sugar do you have?
Ne kadar sütümüz var? How much milk do we have?
Hangisi benim? Which is mine?
Sizin sorunuzun bir cevabı yok.
O ne? What is it?
O kim? Who is that? Who is it?
Kimin çayı o? Whose tea is it?
Kaplumbağa kimin? Whose is the turtle?
Küçük kedim nerede? Where is my little cat?
Hangisi benim? Which is mine?
Hangisi onun köpeği? Which is his dog?

Sizin işiniz ne? What is your job?
Kaç tane? How many?
Kaç tane kedi var? How many cats are there?
Ne kadar? How much?

Bu elma kimin? Whose apple is this?
Onun soruları, lütfen. Her questions please.

Soru nedir? What is the question?
Başkan kim? Who is the president?

Senin annen kim? Who is your mother?
Senin mesleğin ne? What is your profession?
Senin işin ne? What is your job?
senin kaç tana kedin var?

Avrupa’dan mı geliyorsunuz? Do you come from Europe?
Burayı beğeniyor musunuz? Do you like it here?
Burada tatil mı yapıyorsunuz? Are you here on vacation?

Yarın görüşecek miyiz? Shall we see each other tomorrow?

>>> 08-05-2021 21:07
Hangisi o? Which is it?
Q: what does the -si in hangisi mean? is it the 3rd singular possessive?
A: It is used a few words to mean "one." For example, you can also say "birisi" for "one person." I would just memorize it in this case :)

Q: When do you use "Kaç tane" and when do you use "ne kadar"?
A: Kaç tane is how many. Like How many cats for example. Ne kadar is how much, for example How much money, or how much water, it is used for uncountable nouns. But I'm not sure about this at all.
A1: You are right, "kaç tane" is used only for countable things. But "ne kadar" is useable for both.
Ne kadar su? = How much water? Ne kadar para? = How many money? Ne kadar adam? = How many man?

Senin mesleğin ne? What is your profession?
Which is his dog? hangisi onun köpeği?
How many cats do you have? Senin kaç tane kedin var?
Ne kadar sütümüz var?
Kaç tane kedi var? How many cats are there?
*comment: we use singular nouns after numbers (üç tane kedi, not üç tane kediler), we also use singular nouns after "kaç tane".

These questions are very hard. bu sorular çok zor.

Soru nedir? What is the question?
Q: Can I say "Soru ne?" ?
A: yes, nedir is used to be formal.
Q: Can you say "What question?"
A: no, that would be "hangi soru?" or maybe "ne sorusu?" depending on the context.
Q: (and) what case would be that final "su" (in the world "sorusu")? ^_^
A: possessive, I guess you can think of it as "the question of what?".
